intro: Cephalonoplos setosus, commonly known as the spiny-headed sunflower, is a unique flowering plant characterized by its distinctive, spiky inflorescence. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the family. Its leaves are usually alternate and serrated, with a rough texture. Cephalonoplos setosus is native to arid regions and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils with full sun exposure.
